page.title: 08Antique Fairs, Wombourne
page.content: They seem to happen every month. My mum sees the adverts in the local shop windows. They look more like jumble sales to me but dad says that sometimes you can get a bargain there. They have them in the community centre or at my brother's school. I think that they try to get you to buy things that other people throw away. You even have to pay just to go in. There are usually about 20 stalls where the sellers sit behind long tables. On the tables are the items which they are hoping to sell. Old stamps, foreign coins, cigarette cards, jewellry, painted plates, old books and maps: would you want to pay money for something that was not even new when you bought it? I wouldn't. But my dad did. He bought one book end to stop his old books from falling over.
